member.name: M:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.AdomdConnection.GetSchemaDataSet(System.Guid,System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns schema information from a data source by using a Guid object to specify which schema information to return and by applying any specified restrictions to the information.
member.returns: A DataSet that represents the contents of the specified OLE DB schema rowset.
member.param: A Guid object that specifies the schema table to be returned.

An array of Object objects that specifies the values for the restriction columns that the schema table uses. These values are applied in the order of the restriction columns. That is, the first restriction value applies to the first restriction column, the second restriction value applies to the second restriction column, and so on.

member.returns: A DataSet that represents the contents of the specified OLE DB schema table.
member.param: The name of the schema to be retrieved.
A collection of objects that specifies the values for the restriction columns used by the schema table.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.AdomdConnection.GetSchemaDataSet(System.Guid,System.Object[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns schema information from a data source by using a Guid object to identify the information, applying any specified restrictions on the information, and optionally throwing an exception when inline errors occur.
member.returns: A DataSet that represents the contents of the specified OLE DB schema rowset.
member.param: If true, inline errors cause an exception to be thrown; otherwise DataRow.GetColumnError is used to determine the error generated.
A Guid object that specifies the schema table to be returned.

An array of Object objects that specifies the values for the restriction columns that are used by the schema table. These values are applied in the order of the restriction columns. That is, the first restriction value applies to the first restriction column, the second restriction value applies to the second restriction column, and so on.

Determines whether to resolve the unique name on the server if it is not found in the client cache. Setting this to false may improve performance by preventing round trips to the server when objects are not found in the client cache. member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Accounts
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains an accounts structure with parent-child relationships.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.BillOfMaterials
member.summary: Describes a dimension that represents a material/component breakdown. The parent-child relationship implies a parent composed of its children.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Channel
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains information about a distribution channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Currency
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains currency information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Customers
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains customer information. The lowest level represents individual customers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Geography
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains a geographic hierarchy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Measure
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains measures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Organization
member.summary: Describes a dimension that represents the reporting structure of an organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Other
member.summary: Describes a dimension of the default dimension type, which is used for dimensions that are not time dimensions or measure dimensions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Products
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains product information. The lowest level represents individual products.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Promotion
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains information about marketing and advertising promotions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Quantitative
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains quantitative elements (for example, income level, or number of children).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Rates
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains different types of rates (for example, buy, sell, or discounted).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Scenario
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains different business scenarios.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Time
member.summary: Indicates that a dimension refers to time (for example, year, month, week, day).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Unknown
member.summary: Describes a dimension with an unknown or unspecified type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.DimensionTypeEnum.Utility
member.summary: Describes a dimension that contains only calculated members. This type of dimension is usually used for data visualization techniques.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Account
member.summary: Indicates that a level exists within an account dimension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.All
member.summary: Indicates the top (All) level of a dimension (the one that precalculates all the members of all lower levels).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.BomResource
member.summary: Indicates that a level is part of a bill of materials dimension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Calculated
member.summary: Indicates that a level is calculated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Channel
member.summary: Indicates that a level exists within a distribution channel dimension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Company
member.summary: Indicates that a level contains information about a company.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.CurrencyDestination
member.summary: Indicates that a level contains information about the resulting currency after a foreign exchange conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.CurrencySource
member.summary: Indicates that a level contains information about the starting currency before a foreign exchange conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Customer
member.summary: Indicates that a level contains information about an individual customer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.CustomerGroup
member.summary: Indicates that a level contains information about a customer group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.CustomerHousehold
member.summary: Indicates that a level contains information about an entire household.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoCity
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a city name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoContinent
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a continent name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoCountry
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a country or region name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoCounty
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a county name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoPoint
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a location type that does not fit into the other geographic categories.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoPostalCode
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a postal code.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoRegion
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a custom-defined region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.GeoStateOrProvince
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a state or province name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.OrgUnit
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to the name of a unit within a larger organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Person
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to an individual within a larger organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Product
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to an individual product.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.ProductGroup
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a product group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Promotion
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a promotion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Quantitative
member.summary: Indicates that a level refers to a quantitative member within a quantitative dimension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Regular
member.summary: Indicates that the level is not related to time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Representative

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Reserved1

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.LevelTypeEnum.Scenario

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Cluster
member.summary: The node represents a cluster detected by the algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.CustomBase
member.summary: Represents the starting point for custom node types. Custom node types must be integers greater in value than this constant. This type is used by plug-in algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Distribution
member.summary: The node represents a leaf of a classification tree.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.InputAttribute
member.summary: The node corresponds to a predictable attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.InputAttributeState
member.summary: The node contains statistics about the states of an input attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Interior
member.summary: The node represents an interior split node in a classification tree.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.ItemSet
member.summary: The node represents an itemset detected by the algorithm

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Model
member.summary: The root content node. This node applies to all algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NaiveBayesMarginalStatNode
member.summary: The node containing marginal statistics about the training set, stored in a format used by the Naïve Bayes algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetHiddenLayer
member.summary: The node which groups together the nodes that describe the hidden layer. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetHiddenNode
member.summary: The node is a node of the hidden layer. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetInputLayer
member.summary: The node which groups together the nodes of the input layer. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetInputNode
member.summary: The node is a node of the input layer. This node will usually match an input attribute and the corresponding states. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetMarginalNode
member.summary: The node containing marginal statistics about the training set, stored in a format used by the algorithm. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetOutputLayer
member.summary: The node which groups together the nodes of the output layer. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetOutputNode
member.summary: The node is a node of the output layer. This node will usually match an output attribute and the corresponding states. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.NNetSubnetwork
member.summary: The node contains one sub-network. This type is used with neural network algorithms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.PredictableAttribute
member.summary: The node corresponds to a predictable attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.RegressionTreeRoot
member.summary: The node is the root of a regression tree.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Sequence
member.summary: The top node for a Markov model component of a sequence cluster. This node will have a node of type Cluster as a parent, and children of type Transition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.TimeSeries
member.summary: The non-root node of a time series tree.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Transition
member.summary: The node representing a row of a Markov transition matrix. This node will have a node of type Sequence as a parent, and no children.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Tree
member.summary: The node is the root node of a classification tree.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.TsTree
member.summary: The root node of a time series tree that corresponds to a predictable time series.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AnalysisServices.AdomdClient.MiningNodeType.Unknown
member.summary: An unknown node type.
